What's in French PM Bayrou's proposed budget cuts
description: French Prime Minister François Bayrou announced drastic measures to reduce the public deficit by €43.8 billion in 2026, including the proposed elimination of two public holidays. He warned that 'everyone' must 'contribute to the effort' to restore public finances.

Israeli ultra-Orthodox party quits the ruling coalition
description: The United Torah Judaism party has decided to leave Prime Minister Netanyahu's government over its failure to secure military service exemptions − a highly contentious issue among Israeli society. The party's departure leaves Netanyahu's government with an extremely slim majority in parliament.

headline: Top French court rules major porn sites must check users' ages
description: Major pornographic websites Pornhub, YouPorn and RedTube must verify the ages of their users in France, the country's top administrative court ruled, in a decision on a legal battle that has been ongoing since March.

headline: Emmy nominations: 'Severance' leads for drama, 'The Studio' breaks though in comedy
description: Amid a star-studded Emmy Awards line-up dark sci-fi office drama 'Severance' shone with 27 nominations, ahead of 'The Penguin,' with 24, and 'The White Lotus' and 'The Studio,' which tied for third with 23 each.

headline: 'Dorothy Looks for Love': A symbol of French cinema's pained recovery in the aftermath of WWII
description: 'The Summer of 1945' (2/6). In the studios of La Victorine in Nice, director Edmond T. Gréville strove to shoot 'Dorothée cherche l'amour' amid supply shortages and his tumultuous relationship with actress Marion Malville.

China, the energy transition superpower
description: Solar panels, wind power and batteries: In just 15 years, China has risen to the top of the global clean energy industry, leaving European countries trailing far behind.

headline: In China, Beijing cyclists take to the streets at night
description: As night falls, a large group of Chinese workers and students set off by bicycle down the capital's main avenue. Their goal: to relieve the day's stress and briefly claim one of the symbols of political power.

headline: In Angers, you can find world-class fries
description: Winning the world championship for 'authentic fries' allowed Alexandre and William Laigo, two Angers natives aged 30 and 28, to open a new, larger restaurant. The two brothers are now dreaming of launching their own franchise.
